inn1.comm: Two slips waiting and he pushes the first ball in the corridor outside off. Perhaps. a tad wide and the batsman leaves it without any fuss.
And again, veering away from the off stump but it starts from the off stump, allowing the batsman enough time to see where its going
Repeat. Three in a row in that line. Not a bad start, eh?
better. This one landed on the middle and off and moved away and Sibanda did well there to leave it. He leaned forward, saw the ball shaping away and shouldered arms
this one lands outside off and stays in that region, no problem in letting that one go through to the 'keeper

fuller, just outside off stump, Sibanda shapes to drive but thrusts his front foot a bit too across and the ball thuds into the pad before hitting the bat and as a result loses a bit of momentum and rolls towards mid-off
120.7kmph and in the zone outside off stump, left alone. One slip for Kamran Hussain.
first runs. A touch short in length and he went back to punch it through cover point for couple of runs.
just outside off, on a good length, hint of shape in and he leans forward to push it cautiously to the off side.
well outside off and Zimbabwe's captain doesn't bother offering a stroke
111.8kmph length delivery on the off stump, punched back but not much power and the bowler stops on his follow through
122 kmph, angling away from the batsman who steers it to backward point
Around 127 kmph delivery, full and seaming away, left alone
127.5 kmph, full and slanting away from Sibanda who moves crisply on to the front foot and drives through extra cover. He just timed it, no flourish of a bat swing, just a push
in the channel outside off but Sibanda is not interested in the programming and shoulders his arms
way way outside off and its a wide.
beaten on the drive as the ball veers away at the last minute
this time a wide down the leg side
huge shout for lbw. 129.9 kmph, it landed on a length, just outside leg stump - hence can't be given lbw - and struck him in front of the stumps
fullish, driven to mid-off
full and outside off, left alone

shout for lbw and then they go for the 'catch'! Good delivery: it landed on a length, around off and straightened and the batsman was struck high on the pad as he lunged forward. The ball bounded off to first slip

Gone! Sibanda is trapped in front. Again. It landed on a length, on the middle and straightened. Sibanda had again plonked his front foot too much across and tried to bring his bat around the front  pad. Too late. Trapped!
it lands on a length, around off stump and moves away from the left-handed Williams. Kamran Hussain has the ability to move the ball both ways as Sibanda found out .
drifting on to the pads, tucked away for a single
full and homing in on the off stump, pushed to the leg side. One slip and a gully in
sucker ball, full and wide outside off stump, Williams goes for a airy drive and is beaten
127.4 kmph, closer to the off stump and Williams withdraws his bat from the line
Super stop by the young Sarfraz, the 'keeper. It was wide down the leg side and he flung himself to his right to gather. Well done young man.
comes in from just outside off stump and Williams leans forward, bat and pad close together, and defends.
fullish, coming in from just outside off stump. It appeared as if Williams wanted to off drive but checked his stroke at the last minute, the bat-handle rotated and the ball went towards mid-on
hmm.. another wide down the leg side. Third wide of the over and Malik comes across to have a chat with the bowler.
Whatever he told, it didn't help. Another wide. Way outside off.
full and straight, flicked to square leg
outside off, not close enough to interest the batsman and not wide enough to interest the umpire.

Kamran Hussain has done it again! He might not have that much pace but has that lovely ability to bring the ball back in to the right-handers. This one curved in from the middle stump line and Zimbabwe's stand-in captain was caught in front of the stumps. It hit him just above the knee roll and the batsman was on the front foot but it looked out, if you know what I mean.
short of length, outside off stump, run down to third man for a single.
gets behind the line to defend a length delivery on the middle stump
full and outside off stump, driven to covers
hint of swing there. Williams checked his intended drive and pushed the ball to covers
more swing and Williams is beaten this time. It started late in the trajectory and sucked Williams into a forward push. Almost fatal.
slants away from the batsman who steers it to point
hits the deck short of length and takes the ball away from Taibu who lets Sarfraz collect it
on a length, around off stump, punched to covers
full and outside off stump and Taibu goes for an extravagant off drive but makes no contact
on the middle and leg, turned towards midwicket
Taibu is on a middle-stump guard and lets this one outside off all alone.
around the off stump and Williams defends to the off side
shapes in from just outside off stump, pushed to left of mid-on for a single
Taibu walks down the track and works a 129kmph delivery on the middle stump to square leg
Taibu is an adventurous mood here. Another walk down the line, Hussain drags back the length but doesn't have the pace to hustle Taibu who just flat-bats it down the ground.
pushed to covers.
again that walk down the track, Hussain keeps it on a length, around off stump and Taibu fails to connect properly with his pull shot and the ball rolls away to the leg side
110.0 kmph delivery full and outside off, left alone.
on the off stump line, pushed to covers
on a length, just outside off stump, pushed towards mid-on
Taibu walks down the track and tries to flat-bat it and the ball rolls away to covers
on a length, on the off stump line, punched to covers
full and down the leg side, glanced to the fine-leg boundary.
again drifting towards the pads, milked past square leg
on the off and middle, from a length, pushed back to the bowler
short of length, on the middle and off, worked towards mid-on
length delivery just outside off stump and punched on the up to that man at short cover
fullish, on the stumps, whipped back down the track and Sohail stops it with his boot, the ball rolls to the leg side and Taibu rushes across for a quick single
on the pads, tickled to the leg side
sensing Taibu might come down the track, Tanvir pitches it short but Taibu pulls it high in the air towards deep midwicket
plonks his front foot out even before the delivery and drives to mid-off
length delivery angling away from Taibu who tries to force it on the up but doesn't get much power behind it
he keeps walking down the track - could sponsor Johny Walker - and whips a fullish delivery to midwicket
guided to cover point and they take a quick single
length delivery just outside off stump and Williams defends compactly. He has pretty neat technique while defending. He doesn't push at the ball and plays close to the body
cuts in from a length and evades the intended flick and strikes high on the pad. Going down the leg side.
112.7 kmph delivery, full and on the middle and off, driven to right of mid-off where Malik makes the stop and fires in a direct hit at the non-striker's end.
another slower one - 114.4 kmph, Taibu comes down the track again but finds no pace to work with and pushes it to the leg side
crack. A tad short in length and Taibu stays at his crease this time and cuts it through point
a gentle loosener to start off with - the speed guns didn't register the speed - on the off stump line, defended to the off side.
135.7 kmph, on the legs, clipped through square leg for three runs
139.5 kmph - released with a grunt, full and on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
137.1 kmph, full and straight, driven to left of mid-on where Latif makes a neat diving stop.
sharp bouncer there. The gun says 137.1 kmph but Waqar Younis, on air, was impressed. "That is quick, good ball." Taibu was late on the pull, beaten by the pace
Taibu responds in style. Around 136 kmph delivery, a touch short of length and Taibu cracks it past point.
short of length, just outside off stump, the length and the slow pace allowed Williams to whip it past square leg
quick run. Pushed straight to mid-off and Taibu set off for a risky single but the fielder didn't pick up the ball cleanly and that allowed Taibu to complete the run
126.9 kmph, lands on a length, just outside off and moves away, Williams pushes at it and the movement beats him and he gets a outside edge to point
full and straight, driven down the track and Hussain dives to his left to make a half-stop
sliced over point. It was full and straight, outside off stump and Williams scooped it over the off-side field.
nicely clipped off the pads. It was short in length, on the middle and leg and Williams whipped it past square leg
defended on the front foot
137.1 kmph, length delivery on the off stump, Taibu pushes it to covers
quicker. 138.1 kmph delivery, bursted off the length, around the off stump and Taibu went for a cut but was late
138.1 k again, fuller and Taibu drives to mid-off
on the middle stump line, turned to the leg side.
conventional legbreak, on the middle, worked to midwicket
floated on the leg and middle, turned behind square leg
turn and bounce. Trifle short though  and Taibu manages to get it over cover with a cut shot.
fuller and is driven to the bowler
crispy drive through covers. Full and outside off stump, Williams leaned forward to caress it through covers
slider on the middle stump, went on straight and Williams was initially to looking to play it towards square leg but adjusts and pushes it down to mid-on
137.8 kmph delivery just outside off and Taibu goes down on his knee to cut it but can't beat the point fielder. Khan doesn't have a long run-up for those who are wondering.
139.1 kmph short-of-length delivery and cut to Yousuf at deep point
on a length, just outside off stump, played with soft-hands to the off side and they rush across for a single
length delivery on the off stump, played to covers
138.5 kmph, short and kicking up outside off stump, Taibu goes for a cut but beaten by the extra bounce.
135. 8 kmph bouncer, around the off stump and Taibu sways away from the line
clipped off the pads to deep square leg
tight run, driven to extra covers and Nasir fires in a throw to Sarfraz who breaks the stumps but Williams was in by then. A direct hit could have made the difference
floated outside off stump, cut uppishly past backward point
Willaims goes down town. He charges down the track to heave Afridi over long-on
googly outside off, Williams reaches out to cut it to point
on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside leg, tucked off the hips into the gap
flashed at outside off stump, the ball deviating away off a good length and Taibu comes down late on the shot
back of a length on off stump, Taibu squirts it from the crease to gully
back of a length but a touch wider and Taibut punches off the back foot, just placing it wide of gully this time
this one sits up into Williams' ribs, from leg stump, but he backs away and drops the soft hands on it, dribbling the ball wide of the 'keeper and responds well to Taibu's call
bang, thats four! Taibu gets a half-tracker and pulls from outside off stump, and though its not timed well he places it over midwicket, powerful shot that
pitches outside leg and spins in, he mistimes his attempted nudge
spins away from off stump, he gets back and pushes into the covers
pitches on leg, spins down, Sarfraz collects but wide is the call
tossed up on a length, Taibu on-drives nicely, wide of the stumps
gives it some air, its wide, Williams reaches out and drives into the covers
spins down the pads from middle and leg, good take, wide not called
tidy delivery, flighted on an off stump length, Taibu pushes firmly to point
short of a length on off stump, Williams waits and dabs wide of gully
good length, Taibu drives uppishly to extra cover, where Afridi lets it through his hands and gives up a couple that was never on
bit of width and Taibu unveils a hard cut shot, slashing out to deep point
steams in and bounces him, but its over leg stump and very high, and the umpire calls it wide for height
much better line, middle and off, drawing a lovely back-foot drive to mid-off
slower ball, good length on off stump, soft hands gets him one past gully
width and he gets up on the toes to cut hard out to Yousuf in the deep
turns in from outside off, Taibu works it to deep midwicket for a single
leans forward, opens the bat-face to steer to cover point
sharp turn. It landed on leg and middle and spun outside off, Williams is surprised and withdraws his bat from the line
turned to short fine leg
soft dismissal. Beaten in the flight. He flighted it a bit more than usual, on the middle stump, Williams was late in deciding to drive and ended up tapping it lamely back to the bowler.
full and just outside off, on driven to mid-on
floated outside off and Taylor drills it through extra cover
picks up a single with a offdrive
on the middle and leg, Taibu gets a inside-edge to the leg side
unfurls a reverse sweep and Misbah does well to pull of a diving stop at deep point
another reverse sweep and will pick up a single this time
flighted full, turned to midwicket
slow through the air, floated outside off stump, bottom-edges a cut to point
turns in from outside off, cut away for a single
fuller and Taibu drives to long-on for a single

another lbw. It spun in from just outside off stump, Taylor went back and missed an intended flick to the leg side. It would have hit the leg stump. Zimbabwe are beginning to lose their way. Done in by the spinners.
turns in from outside off, jabbed to the pad and the ball rolls away to the off side. Mushy, on air, wants a silly-point for the new batsman.
runs to the right of short fine-leg
full and on the middle, driven back to the bowler
pushed towards covers and Sarfraz screams, "Shahid bhai Shahid bhai" and Afridi obliges him by running in fast, swooping on the ball and firing a throw back at him
leans forward to drive through extra cover, past Afridi
turns in from outside leg, stabbed to the on side
leans forward to drive to long-off for a single
tries to reverse sweep but doesn't connect properly
turns in sharply, worked to square leg. Mushy again talks about having a silly point and a short leg. The ball is turning and it makes sense to have at least one of them close
picks up a single with a whip past square leg
fuller and from outside off, pushed to covers
slower through the air, on the middle, Taibu waits for the turn and plays to left of short fine leg
leans forward to defend
almost dragged on a reverse sweep to the stumps. It landed outside leg stump and he got a inside edge which took the ball dangerously close to the leg stump
opens his stance and works to square leg
on the middle, pushed to Afridi at covers
sweeps a full delivery for a single
leans forward to defend
lands outside leg, keeps low as it turns in and is jabbed to the on side
on the middle and off, worked to midwicket
fuller, straighter and Taibu drives to long-on for a single
turns in from outside off but it is short and that allows the batsman to rock back and punch it to right of sweeper cover where Nasir makes a diving stop
slows up the pace, bit more air and Taibu defends to the on side
a tad quicker and is tickled to short fine-leg
fuller and he reaches the pitch and drives to long-on
yet another reverse sweep, another single
quicker, fuller and no room to cut or drive, pushed to Afridi at covers
comes down the track to drive to long-off for a single
tries another reverse sweep and edges it to his pad
turning in from outside leg, worked to midiwcket
brings up his ninth ODI fifty with what else but a reverse sweep.
spins in to strike the pad as Taibu tries to work it to the on side
a touch short and Taibu goes back to work it behind square leg for a single
comes down the track but the ball dips rapidly and he adjusts by lunging forward to defend
a trifle short again and is cut to deep point
pushed back to the bowler

another c&b for Malik! Again he tossed it up a bit more than normal, full and outside off stump and Taibu lured by the flight, tried to thrash it down the ground but ended up hitting it uppishly to the left of Malik who pouches it safely
driven to sweeper cover for a single
full and he almost yorks himself but manages to dig it out towards mid-off
driven pleasingly to long-off for a single
on a length this time and is pushed to covers
fuller and square driven past point
leans forward to push a flat delivery to long-off. Not much turn for Fawad.
flighted outside off, driven to long-on for a single
sharp turn and is struck on the pad while pushing forward to defend
almost done in the flight. He came down the track, the ball dipped and spun in and almost went through bat and pad gap but a inside-edge saved him

reaches the pitch this time and drives to left of long-off where Tanvir picks up the ball, takes a while before releasing the ball and Malik is angry. He screams at Tanvir to send in the throw quickly. Fair enough skipper!
turned past square leg for a single
steps down the track and drills to long-off
full and outside off, square driven to deep point
short in length, quicker, cut to deep point
full and outside off, driven to covers. Fawad doesn't give it a tweak and Sarfraz tells him to bowl a little bit slower. Good advice.
that was slower but too full and is driven to extra cover for a single
flighted on the middle and leg, driven to long-on
loopy delivery on the off stump line, turns away, a touch short and is cut to deep point
turned to fine-leg for couple of runs
slider, and it almost went through the bat and pad gap. He played for the legbreak and got a inside edge
beaten by the leg break this time! Afridi is mixing things up rather well
on the middle stump, goes on straight, worked to right of midwicket
full and straight, from round the stumps, driven to the off side and it bounces awkwardly in front of Yousuf and hits him on his right wrist. Yousuf is in pain.
outside off stump, pushed to point
comes in with the arm, from outside off, turned to the leg side.
full and outside off, tries to sweep but misses and it runs off the pad
lands on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
fuller, quicker and drifted in with the arm, pushes at it at the last minute and manages to keep it out
on the middle and leg, worked past midwicket
tossed outside leg stump, top-edges a sweep shot just over the crouched 'keeper
full, too full, outside off, driven to extra cover
just outside off, gets a edge on the intended drive and the ball runs to short third man
retains the strike with a dab towards wide midwicket
slow through the air, outside off stump, full and he tried to whip it across the line and got a leading edge towards mid-off where Afridi is stationed
goes back to punch a length ball to long-on
slower, fuller and outside off and it strikes the boot on the full but too much outside off to cause any damage
a tad short and is cut towards deep point where Misbah sends in a slightly wide throw and they complete the second run
full and outside off, beaten on the drive
driven to covers
picks up a single with a drive to long-off and Tanvir comes in quickly and Sarfraz likews that, "Well done Sohail!"
pushed to the off side
slips to the leg side and is flicked past square leg
again drifting on to the pads , worked towards square leg
shifts his line to the off stump and is driven to covers
slider evades the intended forward defence and strikes him on the pad but it was going down leg side
short and is punched to sweeper cover
keeps low just outside off, punched to covers
full, straight, just outside off, whipped through wide midwicket
tossed up, pushed to the leg side
goes back to cut a fullish delivery actually to deep point . He could have got on to the front foot for that but he had obviously predetermined to play a cut
now goes forward and drives to covers
comes in with the angle, pushed to covers
low full toss and paddled away to fine leg

89.6 kmph quick slider cleans him up. Caught Chibhabha completely by surprise. It landed on a length and by the time he tried to bring the bat down, the ball had whistled through straight and crashed into the middle stump. Afridi,. as his wont, points his index finger to the skies. Even Ashoka de Silva can't supress a smile.
full and straight and the left-handed Debengwa drives to long-off for a single
conventional leg break outside off, steered to right of backward point for a quick single
full and outside off, square driven to point
Stumped! It was full and well outside off stump, Chigumbura tried to whip it across the line, missed and fell over in the process. Sarfraz was quick to whip off the bails.
short, quickish, pushed back to the bowler
comes down the track and picks up a single with a drive through mid-off
on the off stump line, again no turn, driven to long-off
comes down the track and drills a full toss straight down the ground. Sarfraz says, "Never mind Never mind."
on the off stump, defended to the off side
well outside the off stump, close to being called a wide
turned in from outside off, pushed to point
square driven past point for a single
full, quicker but drifting on to the legs, flicked away
on the middle and leg, nurdled past square leg for a single
outside leg stump, dabbed to vacant midwicket for a single
swept from outside off and Sarfraz shouts, "one one," before adding, "well done Sohail"
this time the batsman will get two runs; the sweep shot took the ball finer
sliding down leg side, nudged close to the leg side and Sarfraz throws his gloves away and quickly runs after it to prevent a single
flighted and is swept to deep square leg for a single. Again Sarfraz shouts what he thinks should be the amount of runs for that shot. "One!"
pushed back to the bowler

full, really full but the batsman is caught at the crease and drives. He gets an outside edge and runs to third man where Latif dives and tries to make a stop but the ball eludes his grasp and runs to the boundary
again a really full delivery, driven uppishly towards long-on
full and outside off, paddle sweep attempted and he gets a top edge which falls just short of Sohail Khan at short third man
lands on the off stump, skids away and Sarfraz attempts a stumping before throwing the ball towards Afridi in one single motion. Afridi doesn't collect and overthrow results

almost run out. Pushed towards Misbah at covers and the batsman  throws in a dive to make it to the crease. It was refered upstairs but not out is the verdict. Good throw on the dive from Misbah, even better work from the batsman.
swept for a single
goes for a sweep, misses and Sarfraz breaks the stumps and appeals for a stumping. Third umpire is convinced that the foot was dragged back in time
picks up a single past square leg
goes back to turn it to midwicket region
on the middle and leg, nudged to the on side
comes down the track, tries to flick and it runs off the pad
another charge down the track, Afridi fires it in the blockhole, dug out to left of long-off and they run hard to come back for the second run
goes back to punch it to extra cover

Confusion and he is gone. It was whipped to left of midwicket where Malik fumbles a touch before recovering quickly to throw at the non-striker's end. Afridi gathered and was a touch late in breaking the stumps. The on-field umpire gave it out. The replays - at least one angle- seemed to suggest that the bat was dragged inside the crease before the bails came off. Hmm...   And Afridi was pretty late, he collected the ball, moved his hands towards the stumps and stopped! He then proceeded to hit the stumps ...
full and straight, driven through the off side
full and swinging in, just outside off, pushed back to the bowler
goes for a yorker but slips down the leg side
driven through extra cover and they run hard again to complete three runs.
again drifting to the pads and is glanced away to the boundary. 9 runs so far in this over.
full pitched outside off and is square driven to sweeper cover
short and just down the leg side, fails to connect with the pull shot. Wide not given, though.
full and driven to long-off for a single
again full and again driven down the ground for a single
leans forward to drive to long-off for an easy single
slightly short and is cut to right of backward point
runs off the pad to the leg side and by the time Sarfraz picks up the ball, the batsmen are through for a single
114.5 kmph length delivery on the leg stump line, pulled towards long-leg
goes for a slower one but ends up as a beamer above the batsman's head. That just slipped out of his hands and he looks pretty sheepish about it.
short-pitched delivery and is pulled away to midwicket region

Ah! here comes the yorker. It is full, fast and swings in late. The bat is late in coming down and the off stump is pegged back. Never mind the speed gun that showed it as 112 kmph, surely you must be kidding me? Peach of a yorker. Keeping up with the great Pakistan tradition. Not a bad way to pick up your first wicket.
another yorker and this one almost shaves past the off stump
full and straight, defended on the front foot
slow through the air, down the leg side and is swept fine to the boundary
Now the big hit down the ground. He charged down the track, got under the ball nicely and swung it over long-on.
Where does this one go? It has been slog-swept to wide midwicket region
Another one that disappears over the boundary. Malik went round the stumps but sends down a long hop and he pulled it over the ropes. Good late charge by the Zimbabweans

comes down the track, swings towards long leg where Sohail Khan fields and fires in an accurate throw to the 'keeper who does the last rites. Great show by Debengwa, though. This is the first time this series that Pakistan have dismissed Zimbabwe.

inn2.comm: lands on a length, around leg stump and moves in a touch, tries to flick, gets a faint tickle to the leg side
Latif makes his debut. on the off stump line and is defended on the front foot.
gets his first ODI runs with a dab to third man region
shout for lbw but it landed outside leg stump. A touch short in length and Nasir went for an ambitious pull and was trapped in front of the stumps.
he deliveres from close to the stumps and for the second time in this over, he has knocked off the off bail! It was fullish, pushed towards extra cover
on a length, outside off and Nasir drove on the up, through the line and past the mid-off fielder
full in length and outside off, run down to wide third man for a single
closer to the off stump and the left-handed Nasir guides it to backward point
straighter and is driven to deep mid-on
drifting to the pad and the attempted flick doesn't materialise but they will pick a leg bye
again on the pads, runs off the pad to short fine leg
full in length and around the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short in length, outside off stump, mistimes a drive to the off side

his first ODI boundary. It came in towards the middle and leg and he clips it off the hips past square leg. Mushy can't stop raving about this youngster. " I hope he goes on to play for many many years for Pakistan."
defended on the front foot
fuller, on the off and middle, whipped to midwicket
short in length, on the off stump line, played towards mid-off
lands on a length, just outside off, cuts in a touch and is worked to square leg
short and on the hips, clipped away crisply in front of square. Poor delivery.
fuller, straighter and driven to mid-off
full and outside off stump, dabbed to third man region
in the zone outside off stump, steered to point
a touch short in length, just outside off, pushed back to the bowler
and again
length delivery angling away, pushed to covers
angling away from Nasir who tries to square drive and misses
Caught at short fine leg. The ball was on a length and on the pads and Nasir flicked it straight and low to that man placed there.
full and just outside off stump, mistimes a drive towards mid-on
Chigumbura again clips the bails during release!  Malik defends on the front foot
drifting down leg side and is flicked away without any fuss
on a length, pushed to covers
slower one and he gets an outside edge to third man
on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
and again.
overpitched and Malik drills it through covers
drags back the length but bowls too short and Malik slaps it past point
on the off stump line, Latif moves his front foot towards the line and defends compactly
lovely whip across the line. It was short of length and just outside off but that length allowed him to whip it away. Cracking shot.
cuts in from just outside off stump and defended on the front foot
leans forward well, head over the ball and defends.
slower one but Latif picks it and defends to the off side
full in length, just outside off stump, driven to right of extra cover where the fielder makes a neat stop
slower one, full and on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
on the middle and leg, turned past square leg
a touch short in length, Latif moves back and pushes it towards mid-on. He does seem a compact player but as Waqar said, we got to wait and watch him against better opposition and on better wickets
turned to the leg side
width offered outside off stump but mistimes a cut shot to covers
short of length, comes in from just outside off, driven on the up to mid-on
fullish, outside off stump, driven to mid-off
he walked down the track and forced the bowler to bowl short before he slapped it  through cover point
another walk but this time towards the off stump and he misses an intended flick
rank long hop. Slow, short and wide. Malik obliged with a cut .
closer to the off stump, on a length, punched back to the bowler
dropped by Brent. Very tough chance. It was on a length, outside off and Latif, suddenly, played an agricultural shot. A cross batted swipe and it went low to Brent's right and he couldn't hold on
on the middle and leg, wristed past square leg
on a length, just outside off stump, defended towards covers
good change of pace - a loopy slower one and is pushed back down the track
drives on the up but ends up mistiming it towards mid-on
width offered, slashed to point
full and straight, wristed to right of short midwicket where Masakadza makes a lovely diving stop and gets up and throws immediately
coming in from outside off stump, defended to the off side
another off cutter and Latif drops it close on the off side,wants a run, Malik looks at him as if to say, 'are you mad?!' and Latif comes back

Where did that come from?! A fierce pull to wide long on. It was not even short, rather on a length, just outside off and Latif goes for that pull. Hmm...  he was playing compactly so far but of late, he has started to go for his shots.

mistimes a cut shot to cover point. A chip has come of his bat and he wants a change. New bats arrive. Sikander Bakht, the former fast bowler, says he wishes that Latif would continue to play in the normal correct way and not play these agricultural shots. Play with straight bat, he says.
on the off stump, pushed to covers
full and outside off stump, a neat late cut to fine third man
slower one, full and pushed to covers
wants to tip and run but times it too sweetly to covers
full, straight, medium pace, driven to mid-off
another slower one, tucked past square leg for a single
fullish, on driven to wide mid-on for a single
short of length and plays a cracking cut but Sibanda dives to make a neat stop. The ground fielding has been very good so far
and again. Sibanda flings himself to his right to make another stop
fuller, just outside off stump, defended back to the bowler
off cutter but short and is pulled to deep midwicket region

length delivery, Latif moves towards the line and pushes it to covers. He doesn't do much between the deliveries. He just turns, takes two or three steps to his left, then turns back and waits at the crease.
another one on the good length, punched to covers
short and outside off, cut away past point
another short delivery, another cut, uppish but well past the diving Sibanda at point. Four more.
fuller, straighter, driven to mid-on
another cut. Malik is making Brent bleed. He is bringing it on himself actually by bowling short and outside off.
on the middle and off, defended to the off side.

The cross batted swipe has done him in. Sikander Bakht sighs in the commentary box! It was full and outside off stump and Latif swiped it across the line and straight and low to deep midwicket. Williams moved to his right and took it low. Did the ball touch the ground as he picked it? Need better replays to confirm that.
cuts in from just outside off stump, punched to mid-on
outside off stump, a slower one, cut to fine third man for couple of runs
off cutter and Yousuf stands tall to punch it to point
fuller and Yousuf drives but his feet don't move and he can't get power behind that stroke
full and wide, cut to deep point
fuller and is driven to the off side
run down to third man for a single
walks towards the line of the delivery and drives on the move to mid-off
bit of width offered outside off but the length was full and Malik pushed it to left of mid-off for a single
driven to extra covers. Drinks break.
fullish and swinging in, pushed to short cover
full again, in the slot to drive, Yousuf gets forward, drives on the up past the bowler and mid-off
holds the length back, lands on middle stump, he turns his wrists and works it towards deep square leg
the slower ball, lands on a good length outside off, he opens the face of the bat and glides it to third man
good line, comes in and cramps him for room, Malik responds with a solid backward defensive stroke
fullish on the pads, driven through the line to long-on
sprayed really wide outside off, Malik has to stretch out and drive, places it to deep cover
full in length outside the off stump, he leans forward and drives to the covers
wide outside off again, he plays with an angled bat and places it just wide of backward point
Chigumbura continues to struggle with his line as another one goes wide outside off
good length outside the off stump, cut to backward point
beaten..Yousuf tries to glide that one outside off and the ball just beats the edge
walks across his stumps, the ball lands wide outside off, he works it through the line past cover
tries to drive on the up and gets a inside edge to the pad
leans forward and drives pleasingly to covers
cuts in from just outside off, pushed to right of mid-off for a single
leans forward to defend a length delivery around the off stump
another one on the length, cutting in, pushed to midwicket
fuller and on driven to mid-on. Good tight over.
short and outside off, played straight to point. Yousuf would feel he missed out on an opportunity there
fuller and driven to right of mid-off for a quick single
Outside off stump, Yousuf tries to late cut and is beaten
pushed to covers. 2 runs so far in this over.
on a length, outside off, Yousuf mistimes a drive back to the bowler. He is going too hard at the deliveries and has not been his usual stuff where he would just time the ball into the gaps
on the middle and leg, clipped off the pads past square leg for couple of runs
slower one, full and outside off, defended to covers
fuller, relatively quicker, close to the off stump, cuts in a touch and Malik pushes it with soft hands
short in length and that allows Malik to rock back and punch it to deep point
slower one, full and on the middle and leg, wristed past square leg for a single
moves towards the line and on drives to mid-on. The length has been pretty good in the recent overs. Just short of driveable length and they have been around that off stump.
goes back and pushes it back to the bowler. Ray Price, the left-arm spinner, is bowling round the stumps
floated on the middle and leg and Yousuf went down on his knee to play a neat sweep shot
a trifle short and Yousuf went back, made room and played it towards long-on
loopy delivery on the middle and leg, Malik lunges forward to on drive to midwicket
slows up the pace and Malik defends on the front foot
short but it keeps low and Malik jabs it in the air but well short of the bowler
on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
leans forward to a length delivery outside off stump and defends to covers
off cutter and Yousuf pushes it to midwicket
short of length and again Yousuf goes too hard at his cut shot and the slowness of the track meant the ball came on slower than he thought and ended up mistiming it to point
fuller and driven to mid-on and takes a quick single
short in length and is placed to the right of mid-on. The 100 is up for Pakistan.
full and straight, turned to right of short midwicket
slips down the leg side, Taibu didn't gather the ball but just took the bails off his gloves!
from wide of the crease, from round the stumps, driven to long-off for a single
Ah! a reverse sweep from Yousuf. And Malik almost ran himself out. Yousuf had played it towards third man and Malik had almost come back for the third run and was sent back
slower in the air, on the middle and leg and Yousuf waits on the ball before driving to long-on
on the middle and off, driven to long-off for a single
Price goes over the wickets and sends this on the leg stump line, pushed back to him
outside off stump and nicely late cut to third man
length delivery outside off but Yousuf stands tall to square drive it on the up through cover point. Looks like, he has settled now and is judging the slow pace of the track better now.
I should keep my mouth shut! This one cut in and Yousuf pushed lazily at it and got a inside-edge that took the ball dangerously past the leg stump
on a length, outside off, pushed to covers. Malik is on 49
shuffles outside off stump and whips it from there past square leg to bring up his 26th ODI fifty.
slower, fuller and Yousuf defends to the off side
from over the wickets, on the leg and middle, slow in the air, defended to the off side
goes back to punch it to long-on for a single
turns in from outside leg, tries to push to square leg for a single but...

full and outside leg, swept vertically to short fine leg. AGain some confusion between the two batsmen and Yousuf is not happy with the calling. Malik has a big smile on his face and both are now ready
picks up a single past square leg
retains the strike with a nudge to the on side
short of length, cut to deep point for a single
lovely late cut. short and outside off, Yousuf waited on the ball before opening the bat-face late and running it through the vacant slip region
on the hips, tucked away for a single
Malik reprises the late-cut but can't get it as fine as Yousuf and will pick up a single
homing in on the off stump, pushed to covers
short in length, on the off and middle but Yousuf plays it late and dabs it to third man for a single
on the leg , swept to right of short fine leg where a good diving stop is made by Williams
waltzes down the track and heaves a flighted delivery to wide midwicket boundary
from wide of the crease, from round the stumps, full and on the middle and off, driven inside-out to sweeper cover
slows up the pace, on the middle and leg, Yousuf tickles it to square leg for a single.
on the middle stump, driven straight back to the bowler
full and outside off stump and again, Yousuf opens the bat face and plays it late to left of third man
tries to paddle sweep but fails to connect
fullish, on the middle and leg, driven to deep midwicket
on the stumps, worked to midwicket
another cut down to third man, another single
goes back to wrist one past square leg and they run hard to complete two runs
leans forward to square drive for a single
slightly short and Yousuf goes back to milk another single down to long-on
flighted one, on the off and middle, tapped to covers
almost bowled! It was full, really full and for some reason, Malik went back and cramped himself too much, going for a cut shot. He ended up playing it very late and managed to squeeze it past point
a touch short and again Yousuf goes back and works it to square leg for a single. If its full, he drives to long-on or long-off and if its a touch short, he wrists it away.
on a length, just outside off, pushed to point and the crowd indulge in a mexican wave
fullish, on driven to right of mid-on where Taylor dives to his right to make another neat stop. Zimbabwe fielding has been fab
fullish and driven to covers
drilled through wide mid-off. He had missed out on the last delivery, hitting it straight to covers but this time he despatched the full pitched delivery through the gap between covers and mid-off
follows it up with a cute late-cut. He knew the bowler will drag back the length and he waited late before just opening the bat-face and running it fine.
on the pads, misses his flick shot and is struck on the pad
on the off stump line, from round the stumps, tapped close on the off side and off they go for a quick single
fuller and driven to sweeper cover for a single. 150 is up and Pak need 95 to win from 18.4 overs
back over the wickets for Yousuf and its' on the leg stump line, fails to connect well with the sweep shot
floated on the middle and leg, driven to long-on
on the pads, Yousuf tries to work it to square leg but ends up jabbing it on to his pad
outside his leg stump, again the flick shot doesn't materialise but he will pick up a leg bye
low full toss and boy that won't do. Yousuf says thank you and brings up his 62nd ODI fifty with a stylish on drive through wide mid-on
another well-timed on drive through the same region - wide of mid-on - for couple of runs
shifts his line to outside off and another cut down to third man
full and on the off stump, driven to mid-off
another single down to third man. These two don't need much room to play that shot. Great use of the hands.
Ah! Yousuf just shuffled across, outside off stump and played a predetermined pick-up shot over wide mid-on. Drinks on the field.
on the middle and is hit down to long-on for a single. The partnership has reached 100.
short delivery and is pulled to long leg
goes back and forces one through to long-off for a single
short in length, from outside leg stump, placed towards square leg for a single
turning towards off stump, wristed towards short fine leg region for a single
driven to long-on for a single
keeps a tad low and Malik punches it to long-on
slows up the pace, Yousuf backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
floated on the off stump line, driven to deep cover
leans forward to defend towards cover point. They are milking singles
fuller and Yousuf goes back to turn it to right of short midwicket. The throw comes in but Malik seems to have made it. It was a weak throw; came in too slowly
moves outside leg and cuts hard but straight to covers
ha ! It was rank short delivery and outside off, Yousuf seemed surprised and just got a bottom-edge on his cut shot. He could have hit it anywhere he liked.
turns past square leg for a single
comes slow off the track and Malik is early into his drive and takes out his top hand off the handle and drives it towards long-off
floated full and on driven to long-on for a single
flatter, on the middle and off, driven inside-out to deep cover
low dippin full toss, worked to midwicket
Sixy shot! He danced down the track, reached the pitch and timed it superbly over long-on
slows up the pace and Yousuf checks his sweep shot,  rather waits on it before paddling it away for a single
outside leg again but quicker this time and is flicked for a single
another sweep shot for a single
from round the stumps, driven to long-on for another single.
deja-vu. Another single down to long-on.
outside leg stump and Yousuf unfurls another paddle shot down to fine leg. Pakistan need 53 runs.
again on the legs, tickled for a single Yousuf has passed 1,000 ODI runs against Zimbabwe when he reached 76
leans forward to defend and Malik has reached his highest score against Zimbabwe. His previous highest was 80
low full toss, swept to long leg
gets a leading edge on the drive but it still runs away to long-on
yet another one in that region. They are on a cruise mode here.
lunges forward to drive to long-off.
on the front foot and nudges to the on side
quicker and dabbed to right of short midwicket for a single
appeal for lbw but the ball was drifting down leg side. Malik had stretched forward to defend
another single to long-off. They are doing it in singles here. Can we have couple more sixes please?!
goes back to defend back to the bowler
on the middle stump line, Malik brings his wrists into play and flicks it behind square leg for couple of runs
short in length and forced off the back foot to deep cover
slower one, full and on the leg stump line, Yousuf shaped to sweep and tried to flick and missed. It went off his pad and nearly went on to the leg stump.
Full pitched and Yousuf just knifed through the line and over mid-off. Who will get to their hundred first?
dabbed to third man for a single

And Malik is run out. For the 16th time in his career. He had turned a low full toss to right of short midwicket and ran with the stroke. But Yousuf was going nowhere and Malik couldn't get back in time. Taibu is ecstatic.
brings Fawad on strike with a drive to long-off
shuffles from outside leg and defends
again that shuffle and another one pushed back to the bowler
flighted delivery and Fawad lunges forward to push it through extra cover
lovely flighted one, trying to bait the young Fawad who resists the urge and defends.
another one tossed up - this is good bowling and Fawad jabs it away off the inside-edge to the leg side.
keeps low after landing on a length and Yousuf squeezes it past square leg. 34 to win
shuffle exposes the leg stump and he defends a length delivery on the middle
slightly open stance. Guard on the leg stump. Then that shuffle and another defensive stroke
tight line on the off stump, hit back to the bowler
straightens off a length and Fawad had to bring his bat around his front pad but manages to do it and sends the ball to midwicket
fullish and outside off stump and Fawad arrests his shuffling movement and rocks back to square drive it to cover point boundary
left-arm spin, slow and full outside off, driven to covers
really slow and driven to covers
again width offered outside off and Yousuf moves to 90 with a cut to point boundary
more gifts come his way. Another poor delivery - short and wide and Yousuf moves to 94
leans forward to dead-bat
goes back to push it to left of long-off for couple of runs. Yousuf is on 96
down the leg side and clipped down to fine leg
on the off stump line, pushed to covers
Yet another ton from Yousuf and he goes down on his knees to offer sajda. 14th ODI hundred and the first of this series. Full pitched, outside off stump and he caressed it through wide mid-off.
pushes a length delivery to mid-on
cuts in from just outside off, stabbed to the off side
slower one but it slips down the leg side
another slower one and this time it's short and Yousuf retains the strike by working it through midwicket
starts off with a bouncer and Yousuf ducks under.
on the middle stump line, flicked past square leg
on the off stump line, pushed to mid-off
shuffles across and taps a fullish delivery to left of extra cover and takes a quick single. Taylor rushes in and throws on the dive.
homing in on the off stump and is dead-batted
slow off cutter and driven to mid-off
what a long hop and Fawad pulls it but can't beat the man at long leg where another diving stop is made. Zim fielding has been a treat to watch today
turns in rom outside off, pushed back to the bowler
driven to long-on for a single
down the leg side and Yousuf misses to connect with his sweep shot
makes contact with his paddle sweep this time and picks up a single to left of short fine leg
goes back to work it behind square leg
short and Yousuf will keep the strike with a square drive off the back foot
off cutter from just outside off, played to the covers.
another bouncer and Yousuf ducks
Mpofu sends down another bouncer and has a huge smile!
slow off cutter and is punched to mid-off
Game over. Short delivery which is pulled to the midwicket boundary.
